intro: Exogonium woronovii, commonly known as the Woronov's exogonium, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive exogonic structure, where the stem forms a ring around the base of the plant, creating a pseudo-woody appearance. The plant typically exhibits a compact growth habit with thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
